title: HOW TO make a Gravity Fed Water Supply | What You Need.

tasks.task: Setting up a gravity-fed water system using a jerry can in a camping scenario
subtasks: Acquire necessary tools and materials (20mm BPA thread, 13mm barb, Teflon tape, 2m garden hose, inline tap, hose clamp)
Remove existing cap from jerry can and clean the outlet
Attach the 20mm BPA thread to the jerry can outlet, applying Teflon tape for a secure seal
Connect the garden hose to the 13mm barb on the jerry can
Install the inline tap onto the garden hose using the 13mm threading
Measure and cut the garden hose to the appropriate length for the desired setup
Secure the hose to the jerry can using a hose clamp
Conduct a leak test by filling the system with water and checking for signs of leakage
Position the modified jerry can at a sufficient height for gravity-fed water flow
Demonstrate the system's operation and discuss its benefits, safety considerations, and adaptability to different jerry cans
